content.description:
Mesmerizing swirled sandstone and fantastic movement. The top requires full commitment. This arete is the closer of the two, the further being "Lucky Charms"

 This arete is the first thing you will see as walk up from Casablanca and Pentagon. Sit start on the pinches at the low ledge in the steep overhang with a heel hook. Toss up to a crimp rail and compress along the arete. Work out the steep, swirled overhang to the arete corner. Climb the tall arete to top out.

Note: The close tree is the best way I have found to get off of this boulder. Also, be aware that the landing here is potentially dangerous. One direction you have a large knife edge sloped block that is hard to protect, the other direction you have a pointed beaver-chewed stump. Pad and spot wisely.
content.protection: Trust in your ability not to fall once above the death flake.
content.location: ​​​​This arete is the first thing you will see as walk up from Casablanca and Pentagon. The lower steep face has beautiful iron swirls

content.description:
This gorgeous, steep arete and face climbs like a dream.

 Sit start very low on the large, obvious pebbly jug mouth. Move up to a deep finger bucket and then higher juggy pocket/jugs. Reach out to a deep two finger pocket and set up on the fat pinch block.

 Launch high to the thin hueco and work into the massive jug hole at the split in the boulder. Climb up direct past open hand features at the bulge and top out direct.

Note: The tree beside the further arete (with Snake Charmer) is the best way I have found to get off of this boulder. Also, be aware that the landing or the tree downclimb here is potentially dangerous. One direction you have a large knife edge sloped block that is hard to protect, the other direction you have a pointed beaver-chewed stump. use pads for the tree downclimb if able.
content.location: The opposite arete (downstream arete) from Snake Charmer.

content.description:
All the stars.

 On the river side of the Charm Boulder, a few feet to the right of the arete. Find the prominent left facing flake feature the runs up the face for over ten feet.

 Stand start on edges at the flake feature and climb into the smooth, perfect flake above. Ride that feature until it tapers off higher up. Use edges at the top of the feature to reach a couple small crimps at the very top lip of the boulder. Build feet and find better holds at the top for the top out.

 Not climbable unless the river is running low.
content.protection: lots of pads on top of the log landing you build. Hope you hit it.

content.description: A massive boulder directly next to (opposite Casablanca) the Pentagon Boulder. Charm is very tall and has no easy walk off. You will need to downclimb either the boulder itself or a nearby tree. This beautiful boulder is fantastic, but scope out your exit before climbing!
